title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

A response that includes the substitution error of the form x 2( n+1 )+1 = x 2n+3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4620@ appearing as x 2n+1+1 = x 2n+2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4496@ in setting up a ratio is eligible for the first 3 points but does not earn the fourth point.

The first point is earned by presenting a correct ratio with or without absolute values.

To earn the second point a response must:

· use the absolute value of the ratio, or resolve the lack of absolute values by concluding x 2 <1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3CEA@ (without any errors), and correctly evaluate the limit of the ratio, including correct limit notation, and

· identify the interior of the interval of convergence. The response can use either interval notation or the compound inequality −1<x<1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E64@ ( |  x  |<1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@41FC@ is insufficient).

The only incorrect interval eligible for the third point is 0<x<1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E28@ In this case, to earn the third point, the response needs to evaluate the general term at x=1. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaac6caaaa@3C6C@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes three of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all four of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by correctly using x= 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C86@ in the second term (listing the second term as part of a polynomial is insufficient). Using x= 1 2 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C86@ in any term of degree five or higher does not earn this point.

To earn the second point a response must:

· have earned the first point,

· state that the series is alternating and that its terms decrease to zero, and

· present the inequality Error< 1 24 < 1 10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4422@ (or the equivalent).

A response that states Error= 1 24 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@40E0@ does not earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The first point is earned by presenting the first four nonzero terms in a list or as part of a polynomial or series.

The second point is earned by identifying the general term (either individually or as part of a polynomial or series).

Read “ = MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGH9aqpaaa@3A02@ ” as “ ≈ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHijYUaaa@3AAD@ ” as necessary.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The result from part (c) must be geometric in order to be eligible for this point.

If a response imports an incorrect geometric series from part (c), this point is earned only for a consistent answer.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes the criteria below.
